t: Isaiah 63
The Lord’s Day of Vengeance

Who*pn is this who comes from Edom, in*ld crimsoned garments from Bozrah, he*ln who is splendid in his apparel, marching*ld in the greatness of his strength? “It*ln is I, speaking in righteousness, mighty*ld to save.”
Why*pn is your apparel red, and*ld your garments like his who treads in the winepress?

“I*pn have trodden the winepress alone, and*ld from the peoples no one was with me; I*ln trod them in my anger and*ld trampled them in my wrath; their*ln lifeblood spattered on my garments, and*ld stained all my apparel.
For*ln the day of vengeance was in my heart, and*ld my year of redemption had come.
I*ln looked, but there was no one to help; I*ld was appalled, but there was no one to uphold; so*ln my own arm brought me salvation, and*ld my wrath upheld me.
I*ln trampled down the peoples in my anger; I*ld made them drunk in my wrath, and*ld I poured out their lifeblood on the earth.”
The Lord’s Mercy Remembered

I*pn will recount the steadfast love of the Lord,*s the*ld praises of the Lord,*s according*ln to all that the Lord*s has granted us, and*ld the great goodness to the house of Israel that*ln he has granted them according to his compassion, according*ld to the abundance of his steadfast love.
For*ln he said, “Surely they are my people, children*ld who will not deal falsely.” And*ld he became their Savior.
In*ln all their affliction he was afflicted, and*ld the angel of his presence saved them; in*ln his love and in his pity he redeemed them; he*ld lifted them up and carried them all the days of old.
But*pn they rebelled and*ld grieved his Holy Spirit; therefore*ln he turned to be their enemy, and*ld himself fought against them.

Then*ln he remembered the days of old, of*ld Moses and his people. Where*ln is he who brought them up out of the sea with*ld the shepherds of his flock? Where*ln is he who put in the midst of them his*ld Holy Spirit,
who*ln caused his glorious arm to*ld go at the right hand of Moses, who*ln divided the waters before them to*ld make for himself an everlasting name,
who*ld led them through the depths? Like*ln a horse in the desert, they*ld did not stumble.
Like*ln livestock that go down into the valley, the*ld Spirit of the Lord*s gave them rest. So*ln you led your people, to*ld make for yourself a glorious name.
Prayer for Mercy
Look*pn down from heaven and see, from*ld your holy and beautiful habitation. Where*ln are your zeal and your might? The*ld stirring of your inner parts and your compassion are*ld held back from me.
For*ln you are our Father, though*ld Abraham does not know us, and*ld Israel does not acknowledge us; you,*ln O Lord,*s are our Father, our*ld Redeemer from of old is your name.
O*ln Lord,*s why do you make us wander from your ways and*ld harden our heart, so that we fear you not? Return*ln for the sake of your servants, the*ld tribes of your heritage.
Your*ln holy people held possession for a little while; our*ld adversaries have trampled down your sanctuary.
We*ln have become like those over whom you have never ruled, like*ld those who are not called by your name.
